trans-unit.source: Integrate with an on-premises SAP server in Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Integrate with an on-premises SAP server in Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to integrate with an on-premises SAP server
trans-unit.target: Learn how to integrate with an on-premises SAP server

trans-unit.source: Integrate with an on-premises SAP server
trans-unit.target: Integrate with an on-premises SAP server

trans-unit.source: Using the SAP connector, you can connect Azure App Services web, mobile, and logic apps to your existing SAP server.
trans-unit.target: Using the SAP connector, you can connect Azure App Services web, mobile, and logic apps to your existing SAP server.

trans-unit.source: You can invoke RFCs, BAPIs, tRFCs as well as send IDOCs to the SAP server.
trans-unit.target: You can invoke RFCs, BAPIs, tRFCs as well as send IDOCs to the SAP server.

trans-unit.source: The SAP server can even be behind your firewall on-premises.
trans-unit.target: The SAP server can even be behind your firewall on-premises.

trans-unit.source: In case of on-premises server, connectivity is established through a hybrid listener, as shown:
trans-unit.target: In case of on-premises server, connectivity is established through a hybrid listener, as shown:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hybrid connectivity flow</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hybrid connectivity flow</linkText>

trans-unit.source: An SAP Connector in the cloud cannot directly connect to an SAP server behind a firewall.
trans-unit.target: An SAP Connector in the cloud cannot directly connect to an SAP server behind a firewall.

trans-unit.source: The Hybrid listener bridges the gap by hosting a relay endpoint that allows the connector to securely establish connectivity to the SAP server.
trans-unit.target: The Hybrid listener bridges the gap by hosting a relay endpoint that allows the connector to securely establish connectivity to the SAP server.

trans-unit.source: Different ways to integrate with SAP
trans-unit.target: Different ways to integrate with SAP

trans-unit.source: The following actions are supported:
trans-unit.target: The following actions are supported:

trans-unit.source: Call RFC
trans-unit.target: Call RFC

trans-unit.source: Call TRFC
trans-unit.target: Call TRFC

trans-unit.source: Call BAPI
trans-unit.target: Call BAPI

trans-unit.source: Send IDoc
trans-unit.target: Send IDoc

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: The SAP specific client libraries are required on the client machine where the hybrid listener is installed and running.
trans-unit.target: The SAP specific client libraries are required on the client machine where the hybrid listener is installed and running.

trans-unit.source: The precise details are captured here[9] under the section titled For the SAP adapter.
trans-unit.target: The precise details are captured here[9] under the section titled For the SAP adapter.

trans-unit.source: Create a new SAP adapter
trans-unit.target: Create a new SAP adapter

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Microsoft Azure Management portal.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Microsoft Azure Management portal.

trans-unit.source: Select New.
trans-unit.target: Select New.

trans-unit.source: In the create blade, select Compute > Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: In the create blade, select Compute > Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: In the marketplace blade, select API Apps, and search for SAP in the search bar:
trans-unit.target: In the marketplace blade, select API Apps, and search for SAP in the search bar:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAP Connector API App</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAP Connector API App</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the SAP Connector published by Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Select the SAP Connector published by Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: In the SAP connector blade, select Create.
trans-unit.target: In the SAP connector blade, select Create.

trans-unit.source: In the new blade that opens, enter the following:
trans-unit.target: In the new blade that opens, enter the following:

trans-unit.source: Location - Choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to deploy
trans-unit.target: Location - Choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to deploy

trans-unit.source: Subscription - Choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in
trans-unit.target: Subscription - Choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in

trans-unit.source: Resource group - Select or create a resource group where the connector should reside
trans-unit.target: Resource group - Select or create a resource group where the connector should reside

trans-unit.source: Web hosting plan - Select or create a web hosting plan
trans-unit.target: Web hosting plan - Select or create a web hosting plan

trans-unit.source: Pricing tier - Choose a pricing tier for the connector
trans-unit.target: Pricing tier - Choose a pricing tier for the connector

trans-unit.source: Name - Enter a name for your SAP Connector
trans-unit.target: Name - Enter a name for your SAP Connector

trans-unit.source: Package settings
trans-unit.target: Package settings

trans-unit.source: Server name - Enter the SAP Server name.
trans-unit.target: Server name - Enter the SAP Server name.

trans-unit.source: Example: "SAPserver" or "SAPserver.mydomain.com".
trans-unit.target: Example: "SAPserver" or "SAPserver.mydomain.com".

trans-unit.source: User name - Enter a valid user name to connect to the SAP server.
trans-unit.target: User name - Enter a valid user name to connect to the SAP server.

trans-unit.source: Password - Enter a valid password to connect to the SAP server.
trans-unit.target: Password - Enter a valid password to connect to the SAP server.

trans-unit.source: System number - Enter the system number of the SAP Application server.
trans-unit.target: System number - Enter the system number of the SAP Application server.

trans-unit.source: Language - Enter the logon language, like "EN".
trans-unit.target: Language - Enter the logon language, like "EN".

trans-unit.source: If no value is entered, "EN" is considered.
trans-unit.target: If no value is entered, "EN" is considered.

trans-unit.source: On-premises - Enter whether your SAP server is on-premises behind a firewall or not.
trans-unit.target: On-premises - Enter whether your SAP server is on-premises behind a firewall or not.

trans-unit.source: If set to TRUE, you need to install a listener agent on a server that can access your SAP server.
trans-unit.target: If set to TRUE, you need to install a listener agent on a server that can access your SAP server.

trans-unit.source: You can go to your API App summary page and select 'Hybrid Connection' to install the agent.
trans-unit.target: You can go to your API App summary page and select 'Hybrid Connection' to install the agent.

trans-unit.source: Service bus connection string - Enter this parameter if your SAP Server is on-premises.
trans-unit.target: Service bus connection string - Enter this parameter if your SAP Server is on-premises.

trans-unit.source: This should be a valid Service Bus Namespace connection string.
trans-unit.target: This should be a valid Service Bus Namespace connection string.

trans-unit.source: RFCs - Enter the RFCs in SAP that are allowed to be called by the connector.
trans-unit.target: RFCs - Enter the RFCs in SAP that are allowed to be called by the connector.

trans-unit.source: TRFCs - Enter the TRFCs in SAP that are allowed to be called by the connector.
trans-unit.target: TRFCs - Enter the TRFCs in SAP that are allowed to be called by the connector.

trans-unit.source: BAPI - Enter the BAPIs in SAP that are allowed to be called by the connector.
trans-unit.target: BAPI - Enter the BAPIs in SAP that are allowed to be called by the connector.

trans-unit.source: IDOCs - Enter the IDOCs in SAP that can be sent by the connector.
trans-unit.target: IDOCs - Enter the IDOCs in SAP that can be sent by the connector.

trans-unit.source: Select Select.
trans-unit.target: Select Select.

trans-unit.source: Within a few minutes, your SAP connector is created.
trans-unit.target: Within a few minutes, your SAP connector is created.

trans-unit.source: Install the hybrid listener
trans-unit.target: Install the hybrid listener

trans-unit.source: Browse to the SAP connector you created through Browse > API Apps > name of your connector
trans-unit.target: Browse to the SAP connector you created through Browse > API Apps > name of your connector

trans-unit.source: In the connector blade, notice that the Hybrid connection status is pending.
trans-unit.target: In the connector blade, notice that the Hybrid connection status is pending.

trans-unit.source: Select Hybrid Connection.
trans-unit.target: Select Hybrid Connection.

trans-unit.source: The Hybrid Connection blade opens:
trans-unit.target: The Hybrid Connection blade opens:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hybrid connection blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hybrid connection blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Copy the primary gateway configuration string.
trans-unit.target: Copy the primary gateway configuration string.

trans-unit.source: You use it later as part of the hybrid listener installation setup.
trans-unit.target: You use it later as part of the hybrid listener installation setup.

trans-unit.source: Select Download and configure link, and run the click once installer:
trans-unit.target: Select Download and configure link, and run the click once installer:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hybrid connection click once installer</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hybrid connection click once installer</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select install, and then enter the gateway configuration setting you copied earlier:
trans-unit.target: Select install, and then enter the gateway configuration setting you copied earlier:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Relay listen connection string</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Relay listen connection string</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Install to complete the Hybrid connection manager setup:
trans-unit.target: Select Install to complete the Hybrid connection manager setup:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hybrid connection manager installation in progress</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hybrid connection manager installation in progress</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hybrid connection manager installation completed</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hybrid connection manager installation completed</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Validate hybrid connection
trans-unit.target: Validate hybrid connection

trans-unit.source: Browse to the SAP connector you created through Browse > API Apps > name of your connector
trans-unit.target: Browse to the SAP connector you created through Browse > API Apps > name of your connector

trans-unit.source: In the connector blade, notice that the Hybrid connection status is Connected:
trans-unit.target: In the connector blade, notice that the Hybrid connection status is Connected:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Hybrid connection status - connected</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Hybrid connection status - connected</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Using the SAP connector in Logic Apps
trans-unit.target: Using the SAP connector in Logic Apps

trans-unit.source: Once the SAP connector is created, it can be used inside your Logic Apps workflow.
trans-unit.target: Once the SAP connector is created, it can be used inside your Logic Apps workflow.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Logic App through New > Logic Apps > Create.
trans-unit.target: Create a new Logic App through New > Logic Apps > Create.

trans-unit.source: Enter the metadata for the Logic App including resource group.
trans-unit.target: Enter the metadata for the Logic App including resource group.

trans-unit.source: Select Triggers and actions.
trans-unit.target: Select Triggers and actions.

trans-unit.source: The Logic Apps workflow designer opens.
trans-unit.target: The Logic Apps workflow designer opens.

trans-unit.source: Select the SAP connector from the right pane, and select an action from the Actions tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the SAP connector from the right pane, and select an action from the Actions tab.

trans-unit.source: The list of actions are based on the configuration you entered when you created the SAP connector.
trans-unit.target: The list of actions are based on the configuration you entered when you created the SAP connector.

trans-unit.source: For the selected action, you see the input and output parameters.
trans-unit.target: For the selected action, you see the input and output parameters.

trans-unit.source: You can enter in the inputs for the action and use the output of the current action in other API Apps, possibly for further decision making in the workflow.
trans-unit.target: You can enter in the inputs for the action and use the output of the current action in other API Apps, possibly for further decision making in the workflow.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
